description: Change of use from Hot Food Takeaway (Sui Generis) to Nail salon (Class E).

phasing_details.phase_detail: Change of Use, Shop layout changing

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building and shall thereafter be retained as such.
REASON

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020)

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans as follows and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence:
Title: Location Plan, dwg no: S.01, rev: B, dated: 09/07/2024
Title: Existing and Proposed Floor Plans, dwg no: P-04A, dated: 09/07/2024
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).

Details of any external ventilation system if required for the extraction of fumes/ odours from the use of chemicals or nail varnishes shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to its installation. The approved specifications of any extractor shall only be installed in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be permanently retained and maintained as such.
REASON

These details need careful consideration and formal approval to safeguard the amenity of adjoining residential properties and to ensure that the siting and appearance of any external works preserves the character of the conservation area in accordance with Policies DMTC 1, DMTC 2, DMHB 4 and DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved, details of the refuse/recycling store(s) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The approved refuse/recycling store(s) shall be provided prior to the hair, beauty and nail salon use hereby permitted commencing and thereafter shall be permanently retained.
REASON
In order to safeguard the amenities of the area, in accordance with policies DMTC 1, DMTC 2 and DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
Deliveries, collections and unloading shall only occur between 08.00 and 20.00 hours Monday to Saturday and not at all on Sundays and Bank Holidays.
REASON
To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies DMT 1, DMT 2 and DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
Customers of the nail salon use hereby approved shall not be permitted within the building other than within the following times:
09.00am and 19.30pm, Mondays - Saturdays, and;
10.00am and 18.00pm on Sundays, Public and Bank Holidays.
REASON
To safeguard the residential amenity of the occupiers of adjoining and nearby properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan (2021) and national guidance.

This permission does not authorise the display of advertisements or signs, separate consent for which may be required under the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992. To display an advertisement without the necessary consent is an offence that can lead to prosecution. For further information and advice, contact - Residents Services, 3N/04, Civic Centre, High Street, Uxbridge, UB8 1UW (Tel. 01895 250574).
Please also be advised that any alterations to the shop front would require planning permission.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation. These cover such works as - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works. A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced. For further information and advice, contact - Residents Services, Building Control, 3N/01 Civic Centre, Uxbridge (Telephone 01895 558170).

The Equality Act 2010 seeks to protect people accessing goods, facilities and services from discrimination on the basis of a 'protected characteristic', which includes those with a disability. As part of the Act, service providers are obliged to improve access to and within the structure of their building, particularly in situations where reasonable adjustment can be incorporated with relative ease. The Act states that service providers should think ahead to take steps to address barriers that impede disabled people.
